name: Hammurabi
what_did:
Hammurabi was the king of Babylon.
He created one of the world’s first written law codes, called the Code of Hammurabi.
It included rules for fairness, work, and punishment.
why_matters:
Hammurabi’s code helped people know the rules and what would happen if they broke them.
It was one of the first times laws were written for all to see.
His ideas helped shape later legal systems.

fun_fact: The Code of Hammurabi was carved into a big black stone!
